header.title: Obumbratta: Joey Cherdarchuk’s Portfolio
header.description: Interactive data visualization analysis and design portfolio for Joey Cherdarchuk

intro: I design and build interactive visuals with data

projects.name: Thunder Roads
projects.description: An interactive story examining the races of the 2021 Formula One racing season.
projects.alt: A screenshot of the thunder roads lightning plot visualization where you can see a red line representing Max Verstappen winning the race in Bahrain.
projects.badge_alt: Gold winner, Information Is Beautiful Awards

projects.name: Housing vs Wages
projects.description: One of several tools and articles worked on with the USAFacts Data Projects team, this one examining the divergence between housing cost and wages across the US.
projects.alt: A map of US counties with triangle for each county representing the growth in home prices relative to the growth in wages. Home price growth has outstripped wages in almost every county.

projects.name: Heat Pump Calculator
projects.description: An interactive tool comparing the cost of heat pumps to other home heating and cooling options in cities across Canada.
projects.alt: A screenshot of the heat pump calculator tool with title "How heat pumps pay off: Comparing heating and cooling options across Canada" Many small dots encircle an icon representing a heat pump.
projects.badge_alt: Webby Awards Honoree, Best User Experience

projects.name: Opportunity Atlas
projects.description: This interactive map plots millions of data points to facilitate creating solutions that help more children rise out of poverty.
projects.alt: A screenshot of the opportunity atlas. Map is zoomed in on New York, NY and shows the relatively high median rents in the area.

projects.name: Breathing City
projects.description: This animated visual simulates work and home populations in New York city on a typical day combining data sets from four different sources.
projects.alt: A cropped top half of Manhattan animated map showing at work and at home population by the hour across the different building footprints of the city.

projects.name: Track the Recovery
projects.description: Economic indicators dashboard that allows viewers to see the impact of the pandemic and how the recovery is progressing.
projects.alt: A screenshot of the economic tracker tool showing the percent change in employment prior to and post COVID. Three lines show High, Middle, and Low wage employment change. High and Middle wage employment has returned to, or exceed, pre-COVID levels, but low wage employment is still considerably lower.

projects.name: Well Water Quality
projects.description: An exploratory dashboard for analysts to view well water testing results and investigate their correlations, distributions, and geographic patterns.
projects.alt: A screenshot of the AEPHIN Well Water Quality Dashboard showing the distribution of Multiple well testing measurements, along with a timeline and a map displaying the test results for a specific measurement in this case "Conductivity"

projects.name: Data Looks Better Naked
projects.description: A series of animated visuals outlining guidelines for making your visuals more effective and attractive.
projects.alt: Before and after visual of a simple bar chart plotting the calories per 100g of  5 different foods. The first chart has lots of distracting colours, lines, and redundant elements. The second is stripped down and much cleaner and easier to read.
